Package org.micromanager.display

Interface ChannelDisplaySettings

  • public interface ChannelDisplaySettings
    Stores the display settings for individual channels Coords of image to be displayed. Maintains the state of things like channel color, visibility, min, max, gamma, and histogram range.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  ChannelDisplaySettings.Builder
      Builder for ChannelDisplaySettings.

      Range of this histogram displayed for this channel For now, histogram always starts at zero, so this represents the maximum value on the x-axis of the histogram.

    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        java.awt.Color getColor()
        Color used to represent this channel, i.e., brightest color of the LUT used to display this channel
        Returns:
        Color for this channel

      • isUniformComponentScalingEnabled

        boolean isUniformComponentScalingEnabled()

      • getHistoRangeBits

        int getHistoRangeBits()
        Range of this histogram displayed for this channel For now, histogram always starts at zero, so this represents the maximum value on the x-axis of the histogram.
        Returns:
        Maximum value on the x-axis of the histogram expressed as a factor of 2

      • useCameraRange

        boolean useCameraRange()
        Returns whether the camera range is used as histogram range.
        Returns:
        True when historangebits is equal to the maximum intensity coming from the camera

      • isVisible

        boolean isVisible()
        Indicates whether this is visible.
        Returns:
        True when this channel is visible to the user, false otherwise

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns name of the channel that is displayed.
        Returns:
        Name of the channel being displayed.

      • getGroupName

        java.lang.String getGroupName()
        Name of the channelgroup this channel belongs to.
        Returns:
        Name of the channelGroup this channel belongs to
